message: I'm a Christian and I agree with Adam. Fanaticism has no place in the world we live in anymore so let's just quit making mountains out if molehills and get on with life. This is all petty and stupid period.
Some people smoke weed wether it be recreational or medicinal, we get it. But is it really necessary to give it this much publicity every year?

I love you bro! But I know one day I'll drink from the old canteen & see you there at Fiddlers Green. We have lost a brother but gained a new angel in heaven. You always lived life to the fullest.. I'll never forget you man..
Obvious its a temporary construction project a good Dad and his children built! I like it! To bad cardboard won't stand up to the environmental challenges it will face! One gust of wind! Good Dad!

Yes there are more important things. You're absolutely correct. Here's my list: figure out how to get my kid school clothes; figure out how to get her school supplies; how am I going to make my food last; how am I going to keep my house cool during this heat wave because I certainly don't need an even bigger electric Bill. Shall I keep going? Is it a capitalist rat race, but unfortunately I have to pay my bills and support my kid. Rock on to ALL those who are doing more than I ever could. But remember how it is impacting real people's real lives. Significantly.

What a great story. Not too long ago, I read a similar story about a black gentleman who was having to walk approximately a total of 4 hours to & from his job, and he was given a car and a better job once it became public. There's no doubt that there are countless other Americans who are in this same position, but it's never known to the public.
